Reviews.Title: “very comfy bed.”
Reviews.Author: Heather K
Reviews.Content: My husband I had stayed at the Savannah House one other time and had really enjoyed the hotel. I can't complain about the room, it was nice and clean and the bed was very comfy. My only complaint was that were were put in the 2nd building and was not told when we checked in that we would have to go to the 1st building to get the ice cream and cobbler at night and breakfast in the morning. The first time we stayed there we were also in the 2nd building but they had the hospitality room open in the 2nd building. Will find somewhere else to stay next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor wi-fi.”
Reviews.Author: MattHeird
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very good. You have to know your way around Branson to find it. I did not like the wi-fi. I had to go find a McDonalds parking lot to get on the Internet. It showed I was connected but it wouldn't work.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay and Will Visit Again”
Reviews.Author: CarlQuincy_il
Reviews.Content: The entire property was very clean. The staff was very polite and very helpful. Fitness room was small but very nice. Nightly cobbler and ice cream was enjoyed by all. We liked the fact that it was not on the strip and we didn't have to fight the traffic. Nice outdoor seating areas. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Savannah House”
Reviews.Author: Don M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best. The rates are great, the rooms are well kept, and the people are wonderful. Also, it is away from all the congestion in Branson yet not that far from the main strip. I recommend this motel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a good price”
Reviews.Author: Dudley M
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot with work, so I am no stranger to hotels. The Savannah House Hotel was a good place to stay. The price was reasonable and the accomodations were fine. The room was a bit smaller than I am used to, especially for a suite. We were a bit cramped with a king size bed and a pack and play in the room, but it was fine. It was comfortable and you really aren't going to spend a lot of time in the room anyway in Branson. The hotel is split into two sections, and we stayed in the back section, which is a seperate building. It had its own pool and food services, so you could get the complementary breakfast and late snacks in either building. The food was standard hotel breakfast fare, which is fine. They did have sausage gravy one morning that was a pleasant surprise. The room had easy open doors on both the room and the bathroom. What I mean is that my two year old could easily open them. I have to wonder if that was intentional, with so many older visitors to Branson if they purposely made the doors easier to open? We just set our suitcase in front of the room door and it was fine. I would recommend the Savannah House for a nice hotel in Branson. Nothing too fancy, but nothing too strange either. Great value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Branson!”
Reviews.Author: Kris J
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed two nights. Convenient location and was off the main strip to avoid the congested traffic. Hotel was very clean and friendly staff. My family really enjoyed the cobbler and ice cream each night! Will definitely stay there again when visiting Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Recommend To Branson Visitors!”
Reviews.Author: pennyloafer
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay when visiting Branson. It certainly lives up to it's reputation as being one of the best. The manager and staff are ready to help in any way they can. The rooms are clean, the breakfast is certainly a plus and their cobblers in the evening (blackberry and peach) are delicious. The location is just off the Shepard Of The Hills Expressway and easily accessable to the 76 strip with all their shows, SDC and downtown Branson. We will certainly stay there again on our next trip to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jack1258
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Savannah House Hotel in Branson. Everything was great at this hotel. The staff was very helpful and the complimentary breakfast and the cobbler and ice cream in the evening was awesome!! The rooms were spacious and the view was great. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Branson”
Reviews.Author: Ladybug21212
Reviews.Content: I've been to Branson several times and this is by far the best place I've ever stayed. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the room was very clean, the cleaning people very accommodating and if we put a "Maid" sign on the door and came back 15 minutes later, the room was cleaned. It's away from the traffic on the 76 strip, but on the east end of Shepherd of the Hills, and very convenient fo Gretna Rd, and Hwy 65 so we could get anywhere in minutes. Breakfast, served between 6-10 am, was very good - though crowded at 9 am - go earlier to avoid the rush. I recommend putting the sausage gravy on the eggs - really yummy. Good selection of cereals, yogurts, breads, and beverages, plus the make-them-yourself waffles were better than most I've tried. A real treat were the cobblers (berry and peach when I was there), ice cream, and cookies available between 9-11 pm each night. I don't recommend the chocolate syrup, but the rest was wonderful. The best part was that Savannah House was the least expensive place I've stayed in Branson - what we saved compared to places we've previously stayed paid for 4 shows for 2 people. This is a true BEST BUY.;

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: wanda4womensministry
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Savannah House in Branson, MO on August 1-4, 2012. It's a GREAT place to stay...clean, friendly and welcoming staff, beautiful views. Breakfast is great and the dessert in the evening is GREAT! Very reasonable price! Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A clean little, friendly gem with a view to savor!”
Reviews.Author: Leslie M
Reviews.Content: My in-laws picked this location, and I was skeptical because of the low cost. What a surprise! This place is clean, friendly, great location and a wonderful view. It's a little dated, but not enough to notice. The beds were comfy. The breakfast was tasty, and you get cobbler, cookies and ice cream each night. In Branson, there is so much to do, you aren't spending a lot of time in the hotel... so save your cash and stay at this nice spot off the strip and away from the hub-bub. If you are headed to Silver Dollar City, it's easily accessible from the Savannah house and avoids the traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Leah K
Reviews.Content: The outside of this hotel is just beautiful. As you drive in front of the property you are greeted by a gazebo, in a garden with a waterfall flowing down the hillside that the hotel sits on,surrounded by well kept lovely flowers. The front desk area is very nice, and free of clutter. The personal service you get upon check in is top notch. All rooms are reached by going through the lobby to the elevators. I like that security feature. From 9pm to 11pm they have cookies and ice cream for the guests, it is a very nice way to relax after shows. They rooms are very spacious. The beds are firm, without being hard. The bathrooms are big enough that my 17 year old daughter and I both were able to use the mirror in the morning to get ready (without too much drama!). The checkout is 1 o'clock. That is a big plus in my book also. Breakfast is great also.They have bagels,yogurt,fruit,cereal,toast,doughnuts,eggs,gravy,biscuits,oatmeal,waffles,milk,juice, and I'm sure I'm leaving several things out. You wont go away hungry. They food looks and tastes good too. The cold food is kept cold, the hot food is kept hot. The price of this hotel is great considering all the extras you get. You are treated like your at a bed and breakfast. This is our second time here, it will not be our last.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for family of 4 staying one night.”
Reviews.Author: Carrie E
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a nice clean hotel with a hot breakfast to feed a family of four. My boys are 9 and 13 and eat their own weight at breakfast sometimes. For growing boys, the breakfast was excellent. Orange juice, milk, eggs, waffles, biscuits, and cereal (all of the above) were on each boys tray. Imagine the cost of going out to eat at Denney's versus what this hotel provided for free with our stay. The evening dessert from 9 - 11 stayed open later than expected. A great thing since we came back from the attractions at 11:15pm. Our family was able to enjoy ice cream and cobbler. Super friendly stay. Clean room. $60 - $70 range. Two thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some not so great.”
Reviews.Author: TravelinMomma580
Reviews.Content: I guess I had expected more from this hotel, as it was priced a bit higher than many of the other comparable hotels in the area, but I ended up being a bit disappointed. It was an okay place to stay, and I might give it another try someday down the road, but my first stay did not exceed my expectations. The location of the hotel is good, it is off the strip, and it is easy to get to stores and gas stations, without having to go through the traffic on the strip. The hotel is quite beautiful from the outside, with plenty of places to sit throughout the grounds, giving it sort of a cozy feel. Check in was easy, the front desk clerk was friendly. We were placed in the main building, so after we checked in, we drove to the back of the building, parked, and entered the building through the back door. Inside the hallway, there was a huge fan blowing onto the floor... drying it out, I assume. Our room looked pretty clean... not spotless, but clean. There were stains on the carpet, and there was a bit of dust in the shower. The room had an odd, unpleasant smell to it, and the bedspread on one of the beds smelled like dirty feet. The beds were pretty comfortable. There was no refrigerator or microwave, though they are available for an extra charge. It wasn't easy finding a place to plug in cell phone chargers, there was only one free outlet that was somewhat easy to get to. Plugging in anything additional required a lamp or clock to be unplugged. The tv was old style. The decor was good. The toilet seemed like it had trouble flushing. I could see my car from the window, which was comforting. The cobbler, cookies, and ice cream each night at 9 was a nice treat. The cobbler was delicious. The first night, they had peach and berry. The next night, they had cherry and blackberry. Topped with a bit of ice cream, it was delicious. The dining area was spacious and comfortable, and always clean. The breakfast was good: Two varieties of scrambled eggs (plain and with ham), a better than average bread selection, Krispy Kreme doughnuts, yogurt, fruit (peaches and mixed fruit), oatmeal, cereal, biscuits and gravy, and a few other things. The coffee was excellent. The orange juice tasted watered down. Coffee, cappuccino, hot chocolate, and ice water were available in the lobby at all times, which was really nice. Again, the coffee was good. The pool was a little on the small side, but was clean. There was one pool per building, both were outside pools. Check out was easy, and the staff throughout the entire stay were pleasant and helpful. I might stay at this hotel again, perhaps the other building is newer and better taken care of. This hotel has a lot of potential, but they need to do some updating of their building... fix the slow toilet, fix whatever it was that caused the hallway floor to need to be dried out with a powerful fan, launder their bedding on a regular basis, and perhaps lower their prices a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Out of the crowds!”
Reviews.Author: Agape4u
Reviews.Content: We like to stay at Savannah House in Branson when we go down for conferences and church events. It's very clean, the staff is pleasant and helpful it's away from crowds! The breakfast is ok and hot cookies and cobbler at night is great! Not the cheapest in Branson but mid-range.

Reviews.Title: “Yes!”
Reviews.Author: IplayNdirt
Reviews.Content: Just checked-in. Everything so far is wonderful. Just as the reviews said. Sparkling clean bathroom. Nice and clean king sized jr suite. Great view! And the price is a steal. I'll report later on how tasty the food perks are. But for now.... What more would you want? Great if you're main street America but if you consider yourself 5 star you're gonna be a lil disappointed not finding crown molding in your room. Lol!

Reviews.Title: “Savannah House: OK for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: bprop
Reviews.Content: Savannah House is an adequate and reasonably priced motel, but I would not rate it too far above average. The location is really very good, located off the Branson strip but with plenty of options to get to the theaters and other touristy stuff. If you're just looking for food or someplace to shop, it's a quick no-hassle trip from the hotel. The room (a double queen) was clean with a nice bathroom including iron and hairy dryer. It was a bit worn, with scuff marks and divots taken out of the wall where furniture had hit it in years past. The bed was slightly below average in comfort. I wish motels would do away with bedspreads that can't possibly be laundered between guests. The room smelled strongly of fresh paint, which isn't an awful smell when you're repainting your own house but not exactly pleasing at a motel. I left the door open and ran the A/C and it eventually faded. The A/C worked very well. The TV (a Zenith CRT) was fine with a selection of about four dozen channels. The welcome was fine. The staff indicated that my room was in "our other building" which immediately set off alarm bells, but the buildings looked similar in their amenities, with a slight edge to the "primary" building depicted in the pictures. The internet did not work upon arrival; one could connect to the network (Savannah5, Savannah11, Savannah7, and so on - they should really tie these together!), but the network did not have internet access. I tried with two devices. I called the front desk and they didn't seem to understand the issue. Several hours later after getting back from dinner I tried again and it worked. The following morning it did not work again. The pools are quite small but they got a lot of use by the other guests. The "fitness center" appeared to be a tiny room with three cardio machines. The cobbler and cookies are a nice treat, but don't expect too much. The ice cream is the soft-serve variety. Breakfast is fine - typical egg product, biscuits and gravy, cereals, yogurt, juice, and make-your-own waffles. It won't win any awards but if you need to fill your belly for a long drive it will do the trick. One good feature is that the place seems quite soundproof. I know there were neighbors on either side but didn't hear so much as a peep, bang, or flush the entire time. All in all, it's a fine place to spend the night, and reasonably priced. But if you see the #5-in-Branson rating on Tripadvisor, understand that Savannah House is just a basic, clean motel and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “HappyIllinoisguest”
Reviews.Author: WendyGF
Reviews.Content: We had family recommend Savannah House to us, so we booked our room and very much enjoyed our stay! We were overdue for an affordable vacation and we found between Savannah House and Silver Dollar City what we wanted. I am very picky when it comes to hotels, I want it to be clean and the place to look and feel kept up and comfortable. I was not disappointed here. I am in private housekeeping. My daughter tells me I look for dirt, LOL! I do find myself looking around to see if where I'm at is clean. I was pleased to find that this hotel smelled good and looked good even in the stairwell, hallways and elevators! All the staff was professional looking & acting. The breakfast was very good, well stocked and constantly tended to. Our room was comfortable and above all CLEAN!!! The cobbler & pie in the evenings was an added bonus that we also enjoyed. I hope to get to go again to Branson this year. If I do I will book again at the S.H.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in the middle of where we want to be”
Reviews.Author: MissouriBusyMomOfTwo
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at this hotel, and we will be back! cant beat the price or location. We have SDC and white water passes, and we enjoy shopping at the landing and tanger. So for us...this is a great location to be basically in the middle of where we want to be on both ends of town. Clean, comfy rooms. Im a picky traveller.... This passed my picky test. Breakfast was nice... Hot eggs, biscuits and gravy, waffles, and cold items too...lots of choices. Staff was nice upon check in and out. The one and only thing I found odd was being forced to iron in the bathroom of all places. I usually set up everything in a corner away from everyone....and had to drag it all back to the bathroom and try to fit the board in between the toilet and sink. The iron cord was screwed to the holder on the wall. Odd. The evening desserts were a nice touch. I always sleep w earplug when traveling...so Im not sure about noise anywhere else. I was aware of the AC unit grinding away all night along with the husband snoring... Ha. We all slept well...the beds arent too bad. Not the best but okay. All in all we would recommend to a friend and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay 6-20-24-2012”
Reviews.Author: C F
Reviews.Content: Our softball team, Vision, from Kansas City MO area arrived on Wednesday, June 20th and the staff was extremely accommodating with our soft ball team. One of our parents arrived with us and wanted to stay in the same building as the team. The person at check-in looked and immediately found her a room in the same building. On Thursday morning I requested some iced tea for breakfast and the person fixing the breakfast made the tea for me. On Friday we went to the store and got some groceries so the girls would have sandwiches and chips to eat for lunch. We requested the use of the extra hospitality room and were told that it was no problem. If we needed anything the staff was more than accommodating to us. I have never stayed at a hotel that the staff was as nice and pleasant as the staff is at the Savannah House in Branson MO. I would highly recommend this hotel without hesitation to anyone going to Branson. The rooms were very nice and the breakfast was outstanding and the desserts at night were also very good. Breakfast consisted of scrambled eggs with and without ham in them, biscuits, gravy, bagels, donuts, toast, waffles, 2 kinds of fruit and 5-6 different kinds of cereal. Juice, coffee, hot chocolate, and milk were also available to drink. The desserts were, blackberry cobbler, peach cobbler, cookies, and ice cream. I can't say enough about how gracious the staff was at the Savannah House in Branson, MO.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 123sunflower123
Reviews.Content: Every time that my family and I come to Branson,we always stay at this hotel. It is always very clean and a nice family friendly place to stay. We are very picky on where we stay and this hotel meets our approval. They have free breakfast in the morning and they have cookies,cobbler,and ice cream at night. The staff is very friendly and helpful. You will love staying here! They also have a nice clean pool outside for everyone to enjoy. Another thing that we love about this hotel is they have a late check out time at 1:00. We are always very pleased with Savannah House!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for a great price”
Reviews.Author: Wiley G
Reviews.Content: We will definitely come back. Very clean. Nice price. Good breakfast. Like the late check out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Rose H
Reviews.Content: I go to Branson Mo, whenever I can with a church group, we stay at the Savannah House. We are treated so good, the rooms are very nice, the breakfast offers a choice for everyone and a lot of food.

Reviews.Title: “Savannah House was Great!”
Reviews.Author: Cyndee P
Reviews.Content: We were so pleased with our stay at the Savannah House in Branson, MO. Exceptionally CLEAN rooms. (no crud in the cracks along walls or dust or anything even slightly dirty!) I actually felt I could walk barefoot in the room! The staff was wonderful, room quiet and the hot breakfast was amazing. When we left the maids even told us goodbye with a smile. I forgot my jacket in the room after we checked out, and one of the ladies ran outside to catch us and give it to me. Now...that is going above and beyond duty! wow! They served a special treat of pie, cookies and ice cream between 9 and 11 every night. It was a big PLUS! This will be a place will we stay at again...and soon.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast and evening dessert make it a winner!”
Reviews.Author: MaryFromMissouri
Reviews.Content: My favorite place to stay in Branson is here. I have brought family and friends. The staff is friendly and the rooms were clean and comfortable. The best is the hot cobbler and cookies at bedtime downstairs. They assisted us in obtaining tickets for shows. Our very traveled friends that had never been to Branson really liked it as much as my family has.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mildred G
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice and clean staff was great. I agree with Brenda D could use a little updating like coffee pot and refrigertor in room I like to drink my coffee while getting dress. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enviroment.”
Reviews.Author: Brenda D
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice and cozy. Reminded me of a nice bed & breakfast. Had a nice little touch at night about 9 o'clock the hotel would serve dessert and ice cream. However the rooms could use a little updating like flat screen tv,microwave and a little refrigerator. I would use this hotel again for business & family.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Traveler”
Reviews.Author: Joan M
Reviews.Content: Found the staff to be friendly, hard working. The room was more than adequate with a clean bathroom. The breakfast bar was clean and well stocked. Really enjoyed the warm cobbler, ice cream and cookies. Looking forward to next time.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are true.”
Reviews.Author: JRM_Norman
Reviews.Content: Branson attracts an older, more conservative demographic and the Savannah House Hotel fits the bill. It's not a Hampton Inn, or even an updated La Quinta, but it's clean, quiet and reasonably priced. Rooms are small and simple. The breakfast area and outdoor common areas are large and attract a crowd. During our stay, we asked to be moved to a room in the main building for a better view and better proximity to the services. The outdoor pool was not in service (temps were in the 90s) but we had access to an indoor pool at a sister property and used it one night. Parking can be a steep climb in some spots. We'd suggest finding their coupons in the travel mags at the state welcome centers. You'll get the best deal that way.

Reviews.Title: “You'll Be Back!”
Reviews.Author: Vicky3851
Reviews.Content: We have been returning to the Savannah House for several years! Each time we come, we are always delighted by the cleanliness, friendliness of the staff, beautiful view, and also the warm cobbler, ice cream and cookies every night! Great place to meet friends or have a family reunion as the area downstairs is like your own living room. The dining area is open to card games or just sitting with coffee and visiting. We have never stayed anywhere else in Branson once we found this home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Sharon H
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a KingBed room ,Rooms are not outdated they are very nice,Very Very clean.Front porch and Back porch are very nice you just want to sit outside and take in the beautiful views of landscaping they have done,the outdoor furniture is not cheap stuff,its very nice also.Free breakfast buffet (good),Free late night cobbler,ice cream,cookies.We met freinds there and hung out at the hotel and played cards,We forgot my husbands razor,they gave us one at the front desk.Staff is great,I found no faults in our stay,would highly recommend this place seems like a family owned place,with family values.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience at a Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NeNe1947
Reviews.Content: Was very happy with what this hotel offers for the price point. View is gorgeous from front porch out near the waterfall and garden. Breakfast buffet better than most, although bacon would be nice too. Loved the dessert in the evening and the fact they had iced tea also, not just coffee. Would like ice tea all the time, and extra ice in the breakfast area. The front lobby is more like a home than most, nice place to sit and talk with friends. Location is excellent to other areas of Branson, especially nice NOT being on the main strip! The staff were courteous and helpful, especially John in the evening. He was very helpful with our questions and seemed quite pleased to help us. Will definitely recommend this hotel to others and stay here again when visiting Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Phil S
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff and helpful. Found entire hotel very clean and neat with attention to detail. I have stayed in Branson before but this was our first time at Savannah House. We will chose them again when we come back. Hot cobbler at night was a great treat to come back to after a night on the town. We really enjoyed sitting on the front porch eating our cobbler while reflecting on our day.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and delicious cobbler”
Reviews.Author: Sheryl S
Reviews.Content: The Savannah House in Branson sits on a hill with a beautiful peaceful view. It is very clean. The staff is great and very helpful. A hot breakfast is served and each evening they serve peach and blackberry cobbler and ice cream. The peach cobbler is very tastey but the blackberry is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Welcoming and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie B
Reviews.Content: We come to Branson several times every year. We always stay at Savannah House if we can. It is comfortable, clean and a great value. The front desk people are friendly, helpful and welcoming. We love the location to other things without being directly on the strip with that traffic. I would highly recommend it as a family location.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, great value”
Reviews.Author: okeytaco
Reviews.Content: I am such a fanatic about clean hotel rooms and this one easily passed my inspection! After cleanliness I look for comfort. Our king room had a leather love seat and a leather over-sized chair with a coffee table. The bed was perfect. So it passed my comfort requirement. I liked that it wasn't on the main strip and we were able to take alternate routes to restaurants and theaters and stay out of the pokey traffic. Buffet breakfast was adequate - the Krispy Creme donuts were a plus. Cobbler, ice cream and cookies are available from 9-11 each night with sugar free treats available upon request which is a very thoughtful touch since so many Branson visitors are senior citizens who might also be diabetic. The front desk was very accomodating when I didn't like the first room because it was on the ground level and I like to keep my drapes open. They found us a room on the 4th floor with no grumbling. I would stay here again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was fine but front desk clerks were not welcoming”
Reviews.Author: mrsmarkfb
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and comfortable. We enjoyed our stay there and would stay again if ever in the area. However, when we checked in the front desk clerk had the personality of a door knob and acted like he'd rather be fishing. When we checked out, the clerk (different person) was on the phone the whole time and didn't say one word to us. Breakfast wasn't great but it was alright. My husband usually will absolutely NOT eat continental breakfasts, but we ate there every morning because they had biscuits and gravy which most continental breakfasts don't offer and it's about the only thing he'll eat (out of donuts and waffles, etc.) The location of the hotel was nice. It was not on the main highway and pretty much by itself, so there wasn't a lot of activity. The price was very right.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Branson”
Reviews.Author: EricSt_Charles_MO
Reviews.Content: The Savannah House in Branson is the area's best value! It is the only hotel in Branson that no matter how many times you go there over the years it always looks brand new. It is constantly being maintained and it is the cleanest hotel ever. It has a majestic view and with its breakfast and late night snacks its is the perfect place to relax It is readily accessible to attractions, shopping and restaurants. The warm staff makes you feel at home and the more than reasonable prices keeps you coming back. Make your reservations early!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Branson Lodging”
Reviews.Author: kristi a
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at all the Branson Best Properties and have never found a reason to go anywhere else! They are consistently the cleanest, friendliest and best priced rooms in town. The staff is always very friendly and helpful and we have never had any kind of problem whatsoever. In October, our daughters wedding party of 23 people stayed in 7 rooms at Savannah House. Seven of them were young children, who played together in the evening in one of the rooms. The rooms are very soundproof, as the noise of their activity couldn't be heard next door or in the hallway. As expected, everything was great. The cobbler and ice cream in the evenings is such a treat and breakfast is always hot, fresh, and delicious. The morning we were there, a family singing group from a local music show came in and provided a bit of live entertainment. What a nice treat! We also appreciate the Christian atmosphere provided at each location. We would always recommend Savannah House and the other Branson's Best Properties!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Free Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: poepoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a recent tour of Branson. It is not right on their "strip" but that was good because the view was great, it was quiet and every morning starting 6 AM free breakfast buffet with much more than any of the other hotels who serve a buffet. This hotel also is one of the cleanest I have been in in a while. Floors shine, carpet dust free*(even around the edges). You won't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Soliday
Reviews.Content: After a long day of travel and not knowing where we were going, it was nice to feel "taken care of"! We slept through the ice cream and cobbler, but breakfast was great!!! We will return

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: tlynnindy
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Branson at the end of July and stayed at the Savannah House for 4 nights; we had 2 rooms (2 adults and a child in one room and adults in the other). The rooms were ready when we arrived and were a lot nicer than what we were expecting considering the price we had paid for the rooms (the rooms were around $70 a night). The hotel staff was very friendly and the hotel was very inviting; there was plenty of seating throughout the hotel, whether it was in the lobby, the reception area or outside. They have pools which were kept very clean. The breakfast was very good and they kept it replenished so that no matter what time we had breakfast there was always plenty to go around. At night, they served ice cream, cobblers and cookies which also was very good and like breakfast, they made sure plenty was available during the entire allotted time frame for the desserts. When we left and came home we realized how we had been spoiled by the bedtime desserts. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting an excellent hotel without paying a huge price. I will be staying at Savannah House when I return to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Great Branson hotel”
Reviews.Author: mckfan
Reviews.Content: The Savannah House was a clean, quiet, friendly hotel. The breakfast was very good. The evening cobbler and cookies were a nice treat. The only negatives would be to add mini fridges in the rooms and add bacon or sausage to the breakfast. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfy in Branson”
Reviews.Author: Tom-Brenda
Reviews.Content: The hotel was tidy and the bed comfortable and the dessert bar at night was a real treat. A great place to meet other travelers and exchange helpful tips about the shows you had seen. We did miss having a microwave and refrigerator in our room but there was coffee in the hospitality room whenever you wanted and the breakfast was nice as well. They also own about 3 other hotels and all serve the cobbler and ice cream and nice breakfast. This one is a little far from the 76 strip which can be nice for some and they do have 2 other properties that are closer to the activity if you prefer. Very worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “First Time in Branson”
Reviews.Author: RockyBayou
Reviews.Content: The exceptional thing about this hotel is the cobbler and ice cream in the evening. They even had Krispy Cream donuts and cookies. Breakfast was above average. Televisions are old but reception acceptable. The room was clean, but a little worn. Would recommend for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: nonny2tnj
Reviews.Content: Listen to what others say and book here! We just got home today (Sept 24) after having been there a week. I can only say WOW!!! This hotel cost us $75 a night for a king room, was super clean, the staff top notch, friendly and helpful, and everything was always just incredible neat and clean. PROS: Very clean, good rate, friendly staff, always clean towels and amenities, lots of cable channels to watch, yummy cobbler and ice cream between 9-11 pm each night, coffee, juice, hot chocolate, ice water available round the clock, pool actually has a deeper end (6ft) to swim in though it was too chilly this last week to do so, it is kept sparkling clean. Also, if you grab a map from the desk or just about anywhere has the things laying on their counters, you can travel the back roads everywhere instead of struggling with the main strip all the time. We rarely got stuck in a traffic jam and were never late for a show going the back way all the time. CONS: Parking is on a steep hill both sides of the hotel, if you drive around back you can park on a level surface, but then must enter on the second floor and walk the full length of the hotel to get to elevators, hallways for elevators narrow and hard to manuever luggage carts sometimes, especially when people are waiting to take elevators, breakfast was ok, but not great in our opinion. Eggs, that come in a bulk bag and cooked so they taste like egg beaters instead of real eggs, sausage gravy from a can, biscuits that don't stay hot, canned fruit, ie peaches, boxed donuts, waffles, you make either blueberry or vanilla malt. It is free though so if you are on a budget, this will save you some bucks each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Surprise”
Reviews.Author: GodsGal
Reviews.Content: We originally stayed at Branson's Best our first night, but with the outdoor corridor it was difficult for me to sleep. They graciously moved us over to their other property the Savannah House Hotel. What a wonderful surprise. It is an older hotel, but very well kept. The rooms were very clean and very quiet. They had a pool (un-heated) which our daughter enjoyed. The breakfast was very bountiful! They have waffles, muffins, toast, eggs, krispy kream donuts, cereal and more. At night they have a wonderful dessert bar of cookies, soft serve ice cream and two different cobblers! It was wonderful. The staff was fabulous and everybody was so kind. We would definitely recommend this to anyone and plan on staying with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value, superior staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Candace S
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to stay at Savannah House. I won the trip through work. It was the perfect place for our group. We had great accommodations, nice meeting room, wonderful maid service and a terrific hospitality room in the evenings with the best cobbler ever!!! THE MOST INCREDIBLE THING THAT HAPPENED HERE IS - UPON OUR CHECKING OUT, I LEFT MY WATCH, 4 RINGS (INCLUDING MY WEDDING BAND) AND A PAIR OF EARRINGS IN THE ROOM. I did not realize it until we got back to Little Rock. I called the hotel and spoke to the nicest young men Aaron and John who asked me to describe the jewelry. Then they told me it had been turned it by the housekeeper that had cleaned our room. Her name was Karen Clark - what a wonderful lady. Aaron and John told me the manager, Michael Zipfel, would call me the next day and make arrangements to get it to me and he did. He arranged for my jewelry to be mailed back to me right away. This is such a testament to the kind of establishment anyone would feel comfortable staying in. God Bless each of these employees for doing the right thing. I will feel extra special with my wedding band on when I celebrate 38 years of marriage to my wonderful husband later this month!! Thanks Savannah House!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: MWTrav
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Savannah House many times. Have also stayed at one of the owners other properties Branson's Best. After the tornado ripped through this property a few years ago, many things were updated. For the price, you cannot beat it in Branson, period. You can get larger rooms and more amenities elsewhere, but you will pay for it. And I'm sure those places will not offer the hot cobbler and ice cream at night, or a breakfast in the morning. This property labels itself as a hotel with a bed and breakfast feel. Maybe not quite at that level, it still exceeds as a hotel. The staff are great, the rooms have always been clean and well appointed for a smaller property. If you have kids that like to swim, this might not be the best place, but for anyone else, particularly those who like to eat, or that prefer to stay on the outskirts of the hustle and bustle of Branson, this literally is Branson's Best. One last tip, they also can get discounted rates on most shows. I've booked a number of groups through them and have always gotten as good or better rates through them than going directly through the shows group sales department.

Reviews.Title: “Great first time stay!”
Reviews.Author: BransonSince1970
Reviews.Content: We stayed because of the great reviews. Normally stay at another top rated hotel that is more expensive. Our room was nice and clean, the staff was very friendly, quiet at night, view of woods and sunset from our room, breakfast and cobblers were good and there is plenty of room to sit, landscaping is beautiful. It would have been nice to have a fridge and microwave in room, but everything else was fine. We are coming back in Oct.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service, Inexpensive Rates”
Reviews.Author: Mark G
Reviews.Content: The hotel called us several days before our trip, and told us they would give us a free upgrade to a Jacuzzi room. The hotel also provided this same room for us when we arrived one night early. We showed up at their door, and they gave us the same deal for that night, that we had for the next night. The service was excellent. I had forgot my fan (which we always sleep with) and the manager (Michael) let us borrow one from the hotel, free of charge. The only disappointment I might have had, was that I was kind of expecting something like the Double Tree does, with the cookies their ad says they provide in the evenings. But the cookies were not the same home made type as the Double Tree. I know this is not a fair comparison because of the huge difference in rates charged by the hotels. Overall, I would rather have the rate, than the cookie. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Branson. It is a nice hotel that will treat you right, and not charge you very much. Mark

Reviews.Title: “Great Branson Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travlingirl96
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 nights in this hotel and had an excellent experience. The hotel is clean, staff is friendly, and the view in the morning. There was a great place to sit outside the front door with tables and rocking chairs and enjoy the beautiful view from the top of the hill. This hotel is a great value for the money. We will definitely return!!

Reviews.Title: “Love Savannah House!”
Reviews.Author: Weezy1946
Reviews.Content: Been staying here for several years and wouldn't stay anywhere else! They will help you with anything! They make you feel like "family".

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KDVH
Reviews.Content: This hotel was such a nice surprise. From the beautiful pictures of the property I thought there had to be something wrong because the price was so affordable. From the moment we pulled up the hotel looked just as pictured. All of the hotel staff were very friendly. The entire hotel was very clean. They have a nice breakfast. We ate ours outside overlooking the flowers and waterfall. In the evening you have your choice of cobbler (my favorite), ice cream or cookies served in the dinning area. If you are familiar with Branson it is just off the Red Rt. Just far enough away from the main Branson strip that you don't hear all of the traffic. It sits on a hill which gives you the view of the beautiful southern Missouri scenery. The only thing I would change would be to have an indoor pool also.

Reviews.Title: “the best place ever.”
Reviews.Author: deenad1
Reviews.Content: My sister & I stayed at the savannah house, what a great place, clean, friendly, a place I will send all my family that visits Branson from now on, great people, great place to stay, we just loved it.

Reviews.Title: “This will be our hotel for future stays!”
Reviews.Author: Mandi1998
Reviews.Content: I had not been to Branson for a very long time and knew I didn't want to stay on the strip with my kids, so I chose this hotel from the reviews and pictures. I have to say this was a great choice. The breakfast in the mornings was great...waffles, fruit, yogurt, scrambled eggs, gravy, biscuits, donuts, bagels, cereals, juices, and coffee. EXCELLENT!! The desserts in the evenings was great..peach cobbler, blackberry cobbler, and ice cream. The kids loved the cookies too. Great to just sit there and talk about the day's activities... The kids love the pool (two outside ones) as it was not crowded and they had fun! If there was one negative note I would say the room had a slight smell to it but nothing that was horrible and I carry Frebreeze everywhere so I sprayed down the linens and it was fine :) I have told my family this will be a place to stay for us and especially for the price we paid!! Great job Savannah House!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Savannah House!”
Reviews.Author: Cardone15
Reviews.Content: We ( two couples from NY state) had no previous knowledge of Branson or Savannah House and picked it because it was one of the hotel choices in a package which included hotels ( with a choice of hotels) and shows. Were we glad we did! I had checked out the website of this hotel prior to choosing it, and I saw that everyone loved it. We did too. It was clean, comfortable, and beautiful. The view from the front porch was amazing. The full breakfast was a great perk, as was the hot fruit cobbler, fresh cookies, and ice cream served in the evening until 11 o'clock, when we were returning from the evening shows. The staff was extremely kind and helpful, including the kind lady who cleaned our room. It is close to the strip of shows but in a quiet corner of Branson. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “We were plesantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: mommatothree_92
Reviews.Content: I could'nt be happier with our stay at Savannah House. The hotel was clean, the beds were comfy, the free breakfast was good and the evening desserts were great! Not to mention the price was so reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite Branson Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel547
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. They work hard to make their guests feel at home. The rooms are comfortable, especially the king size rooms which have a couch and a chair in addition to the king size bed. In the evenings they serve hot cobbler with ice cream, cookies, and coffee or tea. Breakfast is delicious. The price is right.

Reviews.Title: “WOW.....so glad we went!”
Reviews.Author: Stephaniemomma4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I finally felt that the kids were old enough ( 2 and 5) to take a family vacation. My husband worked with a friend who recommended this hotel to us. They told us the staff was great, the rooms were clean and SMOKE FREE. They also told us about the great full breakfast and fresh cobbler and ice cream at night! I did a little research and the website looked good. Everyone can make a hotel look good the web. I decided to take the word of his co-worker and booked the hotel. We walk in the hotel with a cart of suitcases and Pillow Pets and what do I hear first but "Welcome to the Savannah House" . To me hearing a greeting like that set the tone of the entire stay. Everything his co-worker had to told him was all true. I do want to add that the landscaping outside is beautiful to sit and relax in on a nice summer evening. It's off the hustle and bustle of Branson but just right around the corner from the shows and other fun that is found in the hills of the Ozarks.. Oh did I mention the wonderful room rates! I would most definitly good back!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED, LOVED, LOVED!!!”
Reviews.Author: beadizzle
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was very clean, and the hotel staff was very friendly. This is one of the cleanest hotels I have ever stayed in. The breakfast and dessert bars were awesome, there was always more then enough food, even when the hotel was completely booked over 4th of July weekend!!! we will be staying here again the next time we are in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was just great!”
Reviews.Author: GMW9
Reviews.Content: The hotel has one of the best views in town. It's in a location close to all the attractions, at the same time away from the major traffic areas, making it easy to get to. The staff members were wonderful. Michael, the manager, made sure everyone's stay was the best possible, even before he was asked. Breakfast was very good. Excellent value for the price. Overall we loved our stay at The Savannah House in Branson, MO.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will highly recommend it to our family and friends”
Reviews.Author: poorboy_11
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The check out time of 1:00 PM is great. It allows you to go and do things in the morning and come back to your room and freshen up before you have to check out. Also the breakfast hours are great. They run from 6 to 10 A.M. which is great if you wish to sleep late. I almost forgot to mention the hot cobbler, coffee and ice cream between 9:00 and 11:00 P.M. I consider it a great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 123sunflower123
Reviews.Content: My family comes to Branson quite often & we always stay here. The rooms are always very clean. I am very hard to please when it comes to places being clean, but our rooms have always been very clean! The staff is always very friendly & helpful. We always enjoy their free cookies, cobbler & ice cream after the shows at night. They have several items to choose from for their breakfast : eggs,biscuits & gravy, fruit, 6 different varieties of cereal, yogurt, waffles (regular or blueberry) that you make yourself, Krispy Kreme donuts, bagels, bread to toast, juice & coffee. Great hotel & I recommend this hotel 100%!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Randy17
Reviews.Content: This location was a last minute change since another hotel gave our room away. We arrived at midnight and the staff was great. They got us a great rate and took care of us for the entire weekend. We had family at the other hotel and they constantly complained about their hotel while we loved our experience. Very easy location to find and to get to from anywhere in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “5 star all the way”
Reviews.Author: peggyrenfrow
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to Branson for over 20 years and have stayed all kinds of places. This by far is the BEST place to stay. It is the cleanest hotel you will ever find. They offer dessert every evening and a FULL breakfast every morning that is included in the price. Saves a family of 4 alot of extra spending $$! Also, location is great. Very quite! This is the only place we stay anymore. 5 STARS!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Shelter from flood waters, extreme kindness from management of the motel.”
Reviews.Author: Kenny077
Reviews.Content: We had to leave our home because of threatening flood waters. We went to the Savannah House because our sons stayed there when they came to visit and received such good service. They were giving all flood victims a very special rate. They serve a full hot breakfast and cobbler, cookies, and icecream in the evening. Their service was excellant and they treated us with great kindness and concern. I traveled a lot before I retired and never stayed in a cleaner or better motel including the Hampton Inn. Their location on a hill behind Sight and Sound Theater in Branson Mo. provides not only a great view but a five minute access to 76 blvd. in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Julie37496
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Savannah House. Very friendly staff, very clean, wonderful breakfast and nice evening snacks. It's a great value and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best but not the worst!”
Reviews.Author: jcharsh
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Savannah House Hotel on 3 seperate visits with my wife and we thought is was mediocre at best! They have made impovment to the property but nothing that makes a impact on the customer I think. We upgraded each of our visits including the jacuzzie and presidential suites but as I said it's mediocre at best!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay!”
Reviews.Author: newlife155
Reviews.Content: We have been traveling to Branson, Missouri for about 12 years now. We always stay at the Savannah house. We travel with extended family and enjoy the convenience of the sitting area in the foyer and sitting at the new waterfall area. The atmosphere is calm and relaxed and we always enjoy the breakfast in the morning and the cobler and soft serve cream in the evening. What a deal! Rates are good, rooms are clean, staff members are polite and accomodating. From the front desk to the ladies who clean the rooms we are always very pleased with the service and accomodations. Thanks Savannah House, for the many years of enjoyable stay in Branson. --Griffins

Reviews.Title: “Outdated & Out of the way”
Reviews.Author: texas_bound65
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the recommendation of a co-worker - what a disappointment. Property is old, outdated and breakfast buffet was terrible. It's definitely cheap and any profit made by owners is certainly NOT put back into the property. No minifrig, no microwave, no in room coffee maker, furniture was 1980s roadside motel style. Walls were paper thin and a/c-heater was so noisy. The property is also a good distance to most venues. A few dollars more will get you a much nicer room and try IHOP for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is the cleaniest,friendliest,and reasonably priced hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: music99
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Savannah House for many years. There is only one thing I can say If something goes wrong which it won't It will be made right immediately. I am a property manager myself and I am constantly amazed at the care and quality they extend. And the owners can be found all around, they are hands own all the time. I have even checked odd places just to find dust>I never have folks its that clean/. It will be everything the American traveler looks for and more. Coffee listening to the giant waterfall is better than a spa.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Lulu0661
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in June while on our way back from out West. We had reservations made for 1 night, however we arrived a day early, and was able to get a room, then decided after the second day to stay another night, and the front desk was more than happy to arrange that for us, without our having to change rooms. We have visited branson many times before, but this was our first experience with Savannah House...it will not be our last. The price is so reaasonable, as we got our room for $62 a night....(after some of the rates we paid out West, this was a very welcome change). We loved everything about the place, with the exception of not having a fridge in our room, but we made do with the ice that was furnished. I am a very light sleeper, but have to say, I slept the best the 3 nights we were there, than any other place we stayed on our 6 week trip. The continental breakfast was sufficient, and there were hot cookies and cobbler, and ice cream in the lobby in the evenings...it was great to get to meet people and socialize.There is an outdoor pool, which looked to be very clean and well kept. Branson is a very friendly place, and one of the best spots I can think of for a family vacation. I can't wait to go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay! Absolutly NO complaints!”
Reviews.Author: jess_h_2
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an amazing view, wonderful staff, super clean rooms and a perfect location all at a very great price! And I can honestly say the extras were pretty great too! Thank you savannah house for an amazing stay in branson!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value--Clean and courteous”
Reviews.Author: Brownie0022
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Savannah House for 3 nights. The hotel is in a quiet location but still close to everything. The front desk staff and cleaning staff are very friendly and helpful. The hotel isn't fancy but if you are looking for an exceptionally good value, this is a good place to stay. The rooms are clean and the aircon works very well which is nice considering the heat. What is probably the best value for this hotel is the free hot breakfast from 6-10 in the mornings. It includes eggs, bacon, biscuits & gravy, cereals, Krispy Kreme donuts, waffles, yogurt and fruit. I would say the breakfast is a little better than a Hampton or a Holiday Inn Express which makes the value even better, In the evenings they serve 2 different cobblers, cookes, ice cream and coffee which is also complimentary. There is also free wi-fi in the rooms. Overall a good value and ideal for families. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “best value in Branson”
Reviews.Author: jimbo04
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my fourth stay at the Savannah House in Branson and we feel it is the best value in Branson. Excellent rates, free 20 item breakfast bar, evening dessert bar, and half price show tickets. This trip we saw Peter Pan buy purchasing tickets through Savannah House. Rooms are spotless and the staff is friendly. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel With Ideal Location on Red Route”
Reviews.Author: lori25_110
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Savannah House twice now and are impressed every time. Staff is very courteous and helpful. Hotel is located on the Red Route..if you have ever been to Branson you know that means it is close to everything but away from the "traffic issues" of Branson. Hotel serves full breakfast in the morning and cookies and ice cream at night which is a great addition for such a low price. Make sure you call, they give a better rate on the phone than on the internet. This hotel is very clean and nicely updated at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “This place is just the best of the best!”
Reviews.Author: toothin
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Savannah House for our 2010 reunion in Branson. We have stayed at lots of hotels in many cities over the years and none of them exceed the Savannah for courtesy, comfort and CLEANLINESS. This place is top notch! We first considered this hotel based on the many positive reviews we read on Trip Advisor. We can now attest that those positive ratings are well deserved. One of the first things you notice is that this place puts emphasis on cleanliness. I mean, the lobby, meeting rooms, elevator, sleeping rooms, hallways, the whole place is kept up very well. This is something we greatly appreciated! The entire staff, from the moment of check-in to check-out, was courteous, friendly and professional. They make you feel pampered. By the way, the panoramic view from the front entrance is gorgeous. The complimentary breakfast is freshly prepared and the cobbler and ice cream in the evening is an added treat. I could go on and on, but will summarize by saying I would gladly recommend this hotel to anyone and whenever we are in Branson -THIS IS THE PLACE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay - exceeded our expections”
Reviews.Author: drewzy
Reviews.Content: Myself and 3 children stayed at Savannah House for 3 nights while attending a dance competition at the Convention Center. We chose the hotel based on price, reviews, and the complimentary breakfast and evening snacks. We absolutely loved the Savannah House. Like other reviews state, the rooms are on the smaller side, but we had plenty of room for the 4 of us. Plenty of clean towels and everything was very clean. One of the best complimentary breakfasts we've had anywhere. Best biscuits and gravy I've ever had. The evening snacks were wonderful as well. Best soft warm cookies I've had also. The hotel was bigger than I expected. There were 2 buildings, each with a pool. Both pools were nice, but we enjoyed the one by our building, a freeform shape pool more. The pool and patio around it looked brand new. The hotel was really homey. I felt comfortable enough to allow my children to go to the lobby for icecream and cookies in their pj's. Others were too. The fitness center was small, but has a treadmill, eliptical and exercise bike. All of the staff were very nice and friendly and everything was extremely clean. Lobby area also had ice water you could help yourself to all day, which was nice since it was 100 degrees when we were there. The beds were comfortable and rooms were quiet. The location was also great, away from the strip, but @ 5 minutes to everwhere we went. I highly recommend the Savannah House!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the price!”
Reviews.Author: ShadowOfHeaven
Reviews.Content: In this price range, it would be hard to find something comparable. I wouldn't call it a luxury hotel, but we didn't want to spend the extra money for that. We just wanted somewhere clean, comfortable, in a good location, and with a decent breakfast. Breakfast included scrambled eggs, scrambled eggs with ham, biscuits and gravy, white bread, plain and blueberry bagels, sometimes donuts, canned fruit, yogurt, instant oatmeal, five cereal choices (mostly sugary), and of course, waffles. The evening dessert was served from 9 - 11 pm and included two kinds of cobbler (not that great-tasting though), vanilla soft-serve with chocolate syrup (or was it hot fudge?), and a couple kinds of cookies. I have some dietary concerns and am also pregnant, so I'm writing the food specifics in case others are in a similar situation! There is outdoor seating too, overlooking the beautiful new landscaping/waterfall/gazebo and in the distance, the beautiful tree-covered hills of Branson. Nearby recommended restaurants would be The Gardens and McFarlain's. Our favorite shows was Six, and our favorite museum was The Titanic - if you like reading. We would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Economical Stay”
Reviews.Author: rlwidel
Reviews.Content: This was my family's second time staying here. We actually made reservations with Whispering Hills which is a sister property. However, when we pulled in I realized I had made the reservation for the wrong place! They very kindly offered to switch it when I mentioned my mistake which made me very happy! The rooms are a little on the small side which others have mentioned but the staff is great. It's clean and we love the cobbler, cookies and ice cream in the evenings as a before bedtime snack. Breakfast is also good. Will be staying here the next time we come for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, comfortable place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: tessiebear
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. The staff was very friendly. Rooms were small but very cozy and very, very clean. Housekeeping did an excellent job everyday picking up room and providing clean towels, etc. Every night they had cobbler and ice cream and cookies which was nice and most people enjoyed that it seemed. Morning breakfast was very crowded when we were there. They had plenty of food - donuts, waffles, breads, bagels, bisquits and gravy, eggs, etc. Nice large eating area. We really enjoyed staying here. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, suprisingly good location and good extras.”
Reviews.Author: staciwms
Reviews.Content: I researched numerous hotels on TripAdvisor and came across the Savannah House. I've never stayed on the NE end of Branson before and was a bit concerned it would be too far out of the way, especially since our main trip would be to Silver Dollar City (located West of Branson). If you like to be in the thick of things up on the strip, prefer to walk to eateries, etc, then this is not the place for you. But it was convenient for us. Since Savannah House is located just next to Shepard of the Hills Parkway, it was really easy to get where we needed to be. Our trip from Savannah House to SDC was only about 10-15 minutes, thanks to ZERO traffic on the Parkway. We were travelling with a 2 year old and a 5 year old. Normally we would have tried out the pool, but the rain kept us away. The pools here are somewhat small, but for the little ones it wouldn't have mattered anyway. The kids especially loved the ice cream and cookies after a long day at Silver Dollar City. We passed several ice cream joints on our way back to the hotel each night and smirked a the long-lines, knowing we were headed to some good soft serve, cobbler and cookies. It was a clean, friendly, safe environment and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A frequent visitor”
Reviews.Author: Critters78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed many times over the year here and have been very happy. The last stay was with our two daughter's and their family. We all had a wonderful experience. Hotel had us booked with rooms close together and were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast and evening cobbler were delicious. We have honestly never been disappointed with this hotel. This is a wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was great from manager to maid. Very enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: tyler4
Reviews.Content: staff very caring hotel was very clean an well maintained will stay here again in the future

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: slinebe107
Reviews.Content: Wow, this has been one of the best if not the best experience I have ever had while travelling. The staff was great, friendliest that I can remember. Everything that we asked for was provided. We were never promised anything that was not provided. The management staff ("John") took the time to get to know us and our likes and developed a better solution for our extended stay in Branson. My family and I will only stay at the Savannah House Hotel when we come to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Find someplace different to stay!”
Reviews.Author: MOmomto6
Reviews.Content: We reserved 2 rooms one month before our trip, and requested adjoining rooms. We were told they could not guarantee adjoining rooms, but they never have a problem meeting that request. I was shocked to find out at check in they did not have adjoining rooms for our stay. That was unacceptable to us since we have a large family. The clerk at the front desk did try the other property they own in Branson, no adjoining rooms there either. That left us at 5:00 p.m. trying to find a new hotel to stay at with six kids in tow. (We ended up at the Rosebud Inn, which was a very clean hotel.) The clerk did tell my husband she spoke to the general manager and he was supposed to contact us, we are still waiting for the call. We are not holding our breath though! The clerk said adjoining rooms are always a problem at this location, so look elsewhere to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Would rather stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: mnshadow53
Reviews.Content: This hotel was disappointing. I booked it as part of a Branson package. If I ever go back again, I won't do that. One can do better making their own arrangements. The hotel was clean enough, but there definitely was a funky smell in the room we had. In fact, the air freshener smell in the hallways was so strong it would gag you. I guess the hallways must smell pretty bad too. Surprisingly there were no glasses, ice bucket, refrigerator, or microwave in the room. This was rather inconvenient. Also, there were no vending machinges to even get a soda or snack. The front desk people weren't unfriendly, but they weren't particularly friendly either. There is no marked handicapped parking. The front door is not automatic and heavy, so difficult if you are trying to manueuver a cart loaded with luggage. The hotel is not close to downtown Branson, but not terribly far away either. The free breakfast was typical, so okay there too. Overall, not a bad experience, but not a great one either.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Buffy24
Reviews.Content: Loved, loved, LOVED this hotel! We had one of the Presidential Suites (2 bedrooms, living room & kitchen) and a double room. We were traveling with 6 adults & 3 children. First off, check in was easy, front desk staff were very friendly & helpful. Rooms were very clean. The presidental suite had 2 bathrooms, one of which had a huge jacuzzi tub. AWESOME! Full kitchen, with small oven. Warning, if you are baking pizzas, be sure to turn the exhaust fan on. We managed to set off our smoke detector! Pool was nice, not huge, but nice. The kids thought it was fantastic. They have warm cobbler, cookies & ice cream in the evenings. All three were great. Breakfast was abundant with food, lots of choices, and unlike a lot of hotels that offer a full breakfast, this place replentishes food as it runs out. It is one of my pet peeves when a hotel lets the food run out and doesn't attempt to replace it. Hotel is very close to one of the outlet malls. It is a few minutes drive from "the strip" area and other attractions, but that is fine with me. Less noise that way. Easy to navigate the are from the hotel's location. Check out was smooth. Waited a couple of minutes because the front desk clerk had to use his cell phone to dial 911 because the hotel phone wouldn't dial it for some reason. Someone had fallen into a diabetic coma in their room and a family member had called the desk. He handled the situation very well,:calm, professional, helpful. I was impressed. Hopefully the gentleman will be OK. One recommendation for the area: rent a pontoon boat and go out on Table Rock Lake. The water is so clean and warm. I could hardly believe I was swimming in a lake!

Reviews.Title: “Get Price and Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: elmnumber3
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay in a clean and comfortable hotel. Will stay again. Great Breakfast. Room was way more than I expected for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place! Helped to restore my faith in customer service!”
Reviews.Author: mpljz
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Branson. After hours of searching hotel reviews, we settled on the Savannah House. It was a good decision. Originally reserved for one night, we arrived a day early without a reservation. The hotel staff was courteous and placed us across the hall from the Jacuzzi suite that we had reserved for the following day. The room was nice, although the building that it was in smelled of paint due to the current construction. The beds were clean and comfortable as well of the rest of the room. The evening reception consists of cobblers, a soft serve ice cream machine, and various cookies. Coffee and other items are always available in the lobby. It was a nice treat. Breakfast was nice, as well. Scrambled eggs, scrambled eggs with ham, buscuits and gravy, donuts, cereal, and other items were available. It was very crowded when we came down for breakfast, but the workers were quick to restock everything. Checkout was at 1pm. I explained to the front desk that we were changing rooms for the night and they cleaned the Jacuzzi suite early so that we could move over before the 1pm check-out time. Jonathan was a big help in this process. He even offered to have someone help transfer our bags to the new room. I would definitely reccomend the Jacuzzi suite. It was nice to relax in the Jacuzzi as well as the comfy recliner. As recommended by a previous review, we parked on the upper part of the lot which had less of an incline. That was helpful when using the cart to load and unload the car. Our stay was great, and we would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place right off the main drag”
Reviews.Author: AgsOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: This place is located right around the corner from the Sights and Sounds Theatre. The rooms were very clean and the beds were very comfortable. The location is just North of the main street of Branson which makes it nice to be so close yet far away when you are ready to call it a night. Silver Dollar City can be reached in about 15 minutes with little traffic from this location. The breakfast had many items such as eggs, biscuits, gravey, donuts, cereal, etc. The best part was every night they serve a peach or berry cobbler that you can top with ice cream. It may not be a name brand hotel but beats them hands down as far as service and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: bonnrdrg4
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Savannah House Hotel in Branson, MO. This was a beautiful place to stay. The atmosphere was so pleasant, from the time you walk in the doors, everyone was so friendly. The rooms were so clean. The deluxe continental breakfast was very appetizing to say the least, Biscuits and Gravy, waffles, eggs, bagels, cereal, coffee ect. and the evening snack was the best ever. Fresh baked cobblers, cookies, icecream and more.... what can I say.... The hotel was away from the strip and the noise. So it was quite relaxing to sit outside at night on a rocking chair getting to know the other guest. I would recommend this Hotel to everyone visiting Branson, Mo. It was also reasonably priced!!! Compare for yourself you can't stay at a much better and cleaner Hotel than the Savannah House.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE, NICE POOL & VERY CLEAN.”
Reviews.Author: PATTYSpringfieldMO
Reviews.Content: Geat value! Very very clean with towels provided for the pool. Evening desert & hot breakfast. Friendly & helpful managers on staff. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Savannah House was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Faithhope033
Reviews.Content: Savannah House was the cleanest hotel I have stayed in. The staff was friendly..although not always available. The hotel was booked but we heard nothing from our room's. We had to book two side by side rooms due to our large family. I can't give enough praise to the housekeeping staff...they did an excellent job. Breakfast was great...but very busy in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: grandmabs
Reviews.Content: Clean room and plenty of room. Great breakfast choices. Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: milotravels
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to reiterate all the great reviews about this property. Just returned from a December shopping trip with my husband and teenage son. We stayed in a dble room on the 3rd floor for 2 nights. If you are looking for a VERY fair price..we paid $49 per night, and a VERY clean, quiet and comfortable room...this is the spot for you. It was a little difficult to locate at first, but there is very little traffic and it is only about 1 mile off the "strip". The little things that some others have brought up are true: the shampoo is a small packet, the coffee is in the lobby, the iron is bolted to the wall in the bathroom. We say "get over it." What do you expect for $49 a night? Overall, it was a great property and in comparison to equally priced hotels..it was heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: scubadive2
Reviews.Content: We returned to Savannah House for my Mother and my annual Christmas shopping trip to Branson. We had stayed here last year and encountered problems which made us cut our trip short. I contacted the management concerning this previous stay and they mailed me a very nice apology and a certificate for two nights stay at our convenience. Altho a little unsure of trying them again, we finally decided ok it won't cost anything and we can always check out and go somewhere else. I am so glad that we did give them another try! This stay was as good as last year's was bad. The hotel has now went smoke-free. Everything was very clean. The room was very comfortable. The location is great. The hot cobbler and ice cream in the evenings is a very nice touch. We did not take advantage of the hot breakfast they served but I heard other guests saying it was very nice. We had a lovely trip!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Branson”
Reviews.Author: tooter48
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many different hotels while vacationing in Branson. I will not stay anywhere else now but the Savannah House. In my opinion it rates right up there with the Clarion only half the price. The staff are always friendly and courteous and breakfast is wonderful along with the cobbler, cookies and ice cream in the evening. Our room was very comfortable and roomy and the view of Branson was GREAT. We also stayed July 4th weekend and watched the fireworks while reclining on the couch. I believe the Savannah House is the BEST place to stay while vacationing in Branson

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: graymace
Reviews.Content: Spotless rooms, friendly service, hot cobbler, fresh baked cookies and ice cream before bed. A hot good variety breakfast. Good fresh coffee anytime day or night. Great location too. What more could you want? Oh, and the price was not bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean With Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: christnme
Reviews.Content: Reserved a two queen room on 4th floor, and got just that. The room was very clean. I am quit picking about cleanliness, and this room lived up to my standards. The air conditioner was a little loud when on. but no big deal. Did not get to use the outdoor pool area, was smaller than I would have liked, but at least they had a pool. Breakfast was pleantiful and good. Husband & kids enjoyed the 9pm cobbler, cookies & icecream. Check out is not untill 1pm., which was nice. Overall our stay was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: TXVegaslover
Reviews.Content: This hotel falls into the category of "OK for the price". We paid $54.00 midweek for a king room. We used a coupon from one of those travel magazines we picked up at the Missouri Welcome Center. Good points include a large room with a nice leather recliner, a table and two chairs. The property was very clean and freshly painted. The complimentary breakfast includes scrambled eggs, bisquits, bagels, yogurt and a belgian waffle maker that guests can use to make fresh waffles. However, it lacked fresh fruit - they only had canned peaches and fruit cocktail. From 9:00 - 11:00 pm they served ice cream and cobbler in the lobby. The ice cream was the soft serve kind - very creamy and similar to Dairy Queen. It was a nice touch although we probably could have done without the extra calories. We stayed in the rear building so had to walk to the main hotel for breakfast and dessert. We stayed from Sunday through Wednesday and were one of the few guests in the rear building so it was very quiet. There were several negatives about the property and if it were not for the low price we would have found another hotel. The beds were very firm - not the pillow top mattresses found at Hampton Inn or Holiday Inn Express. There were no coffee makers in the room and we had to go to the lobby for coffee. The iron cord was bolted to the wall so I had to iron in the bathroom with the ironing board straddling the toilet to make room. The bathroom was small with little counter space and the shower head was mounted so low we had to duck to wash our hair. The AC vents were on the ceiling blowing cold air right at our heads. The thermostat seemed to be broken - even when set at 90 the AC would not stop. I'm a mid 50's menopausal woman and I don't usually ever get cold but I was freezing!!! Also, this property is pretty far away from the action in town and it took us a couple of days to get our bearings. If you're on a budget and want clean, basic lodging the Savanah House would be a good choice. If you're used to staying at the Hampton Inn or a similar property, you'll miss the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: thtwinsmomE
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay. The last time I was in Branson was when I was 6 years old. I am now 35 so I did not know what to expect. I was pleasantly surprised by the Savannah House. This was a special trip for my husband and I. We have twin boys and this was our first trip away from them and believe me it was a very needed trip. Upon arriving we were greeted with smiles and given all of our show tickets. We went to our very clean room (1 bedroom jacuzzi suite) and relaxed before our first show, The Promise which is located right next to the hotel we could have walked over. Breakfast every morning was great and so was the desserts each evening. Everything went smoothly and we could not have asked for more. My children thank you for a refreshed Mommy and Daddy. We loved it so much that we are planning on bringing the kids with us next October. I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay for a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: MSU_07_Vanderbilt
Reviews.Content: Very clean rooms. Very good location if you are interesting in shopping, it is located on one of the alternate routes that is less busy than 76 but goes by the three big outlet malls, and it is right next to the Mansion theater. The dessert buffet at night is a very nice touch and it is served late so you are in no rush to get back and enjoy it. The breakfast buffet was better than most continental breakfasts, but was not quite as good as what we expected based on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel delivers, management and staff do not”
Reviews.Author: lenahbird
Reviews.Content: We do not believe you need to qualify yourself or your expectations (picky, or easy to please,or well traveled, etc) to justify a review-good or bad.
