So we want to be clear that this review is more about Savannah House not meeting or exceeding our personal expectations than it is about the quality or value of Savannah House in general. That being said, we offer our story. We stayed here for our anniversary. This was our first trip to Branson, so we were choosing hotels blind. Tho we were very encouraged by the majority of the reviews, (after all, it had the #2 rating when we were looking!) we wanted to make sure the hotel understood this was a special occasion and a first trip for us. So I PERSONALLY talked to Scott (the Man in charge) about the reason for our visit and the type of room we were looking for before making a reservation. I ended that conversation with renewed confidence in our decision to stay there. (I should add that the reservations were made well in advance of our arrival date.) After a 7 hour drive (and being stranded just outside Branson for another hour + due to an accident) we arrived very tired late that afternoon/early evening. You can just imagine our dismay (many other emotions played as well!) on discovering we had been given the ONLY room in the hotel with a window looking dead on at a pool filled with kids. If it had been a door, we could have walked right out and jumped in! There could not have been a noisier or less private room. Understandably, acceptable noise level in a pool area is much different than what is acceptable anywhere else, and we would have preferred the choice be ours as to WHEN the curtains needed to be closed or how much shrieking and yelling we wanted right outside our window. A very rude front desk would/could do nothing at first . Our [what should have been unneccessary] polite but firm persistence finally led to an offer of a handicap accessible room 2 doors down from where we were. We took what we could get. Basics, like complimentary toiletries are an industry standard in even the most price sensitive chains; but a little foil shampoo sample and tiny bar of soap was as good as it gets here. Nit picky? Perhaps-but it is also intended as a heads up for others who have become accustomed to not having to pack basic toiletries! The common dining room was clean and spacious. We never made it back in time to partake of the cobbler and ice cream offerings so will defer to past reviewer comments. We are more fruit, eggs and toast breakfast people and less of doughnut/pastry/cereal eaters so we cannot comment on the complimentary breakfast either. Then again, the complimentary breakfast was not a deciding factor for us. Being somewhat lazy in the mornings, we would have preferred not having to leave our room to get that first cup of coffee in the morning. Again, not the end of the world. But fueling the experience were our dashed expectations after taking that walk to the breakfast area and finding the coffee barely luke warm and extremely weak. Understand, our displeasure is not with Branson, which we cannot wait to visit again, or with any of the shows, which were awesome (Dixie Stampede and Branson Landing is a must see and do!) or even with the hotel in general-which was relatively clean and easily located. After all, the majority of our time was spent outside of the hotel. No our disappointment is with the questionable integrity and customer service policies of the Savannah House management and staff. And those will keep us from recommending Savannah House to anyone else. .

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !”
Reviews.Author: topher5402
Reviews.Content: The savannah house is indeed a nice hotel ! It was realy quiet they do not put up with riff raff. Realy nice customer service. Super clean ! Good location and unbelievable rates ..Cobbler and ice cream every night free !!

Reviews.Title: “Savannah House - breakfast, cobbler a nice touch”
Reviews.Author: kjohnson9
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend in Branson. Wasn't sure how Savannah House would work out but after reading some positive reviews, thought we would try it. Actually, we were lucky to find something as it was the Summer Car Cruise in Branson and some of the other hotels were sold out. Savannah House is away from the main strip so traffic wasn't really a problem at all. The room was clean, comfortable and the price was definitely right. Nice touches included the 20 item breakfast - we loved that. It was also quite nice to return from a show and enjoy blackberry or peach cobbler with soft serve ice cream in the evening. We've never stayed someplace that offered that special touch, so kudos to Savannah House for coming up with that nice touch of hospitality. The staff was courteous and accommodating. The pool was on the small side but it offered a refreshing way to beat the heat and our kids (11, 9) didn't complain. We saw two shows during our stay in Branson. The Hamner & Barber Variety Show was quite close to the Savannah House and there were absolutely no problems with traffic. It was a great show - very entertaining - with the comedic antics of ventriloquist Jim Barber and the mesmerizing illusions of Dave Hamner. There was some singing and dancing too and we all enjoyed ourselves. The next night we went to Presley's Country Jubilee which was a colossal disappointment. Seems they've been resting on their 40 year laurels too long. The talent was mediocre at best. Many of the performers were wooden and just not very entertaining. We left early to try and beat traffic on 76. But overall, a fine family getaway. Savannah House is a thumbs up, Hamner & Barber a definite thumbs up but would do Dixie Stampede instead of Presley's

HotelInfo.Name: Savannah House Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 165 Expressway Lane, Branson, MO 65616
